FunctionInvocationRequest.name: FunctionInvocationRequest
FunctionInvocationRequest.description: Represents invocation information for a Salesforce Function.

CallbackStatus.description: The status of the callback for asynchronous invocations. This field is new in API version 52.0.

ExecutionTime.description: The execution time of the Function in milliseconds.

ExtendedResponse.description: JSON object with additional information about the result of the Function execution.

FunctionName.description: Name of the Function that was invoked. This name is case-sensitive and uses the format “project name-function name”

InvokingNamespacePrefix.description: Prefix of the namespace that invokes the function. A namespace can invoke the global function using an installed package via Apex.

NamespacePrefix.description: The namespace prefix that is associated with this object. This object is available in API version 53.0 and later. Each Developer Edition org that creates a managed package has a unique namespace prefix. Limit: 15 characters. You can refer to a component in a managed package by using the namespacePrefix__componentName notation.

ResponseBody.description: Response body of the invoked Function.

ResponseContentType.description: Content type of the response body of the invoked Function. For example, the content type could be application/json, text/csv, or various other values depending on what the Function returned.

ResponseName.description: Name of response, not currently used.

ResponseUncompressedLength.description: Uncompressed length of the Function response, if the response content was compressed.

StackTrace.description: If there was an error invoking the function, this field contains the Function stack trace.

Status.description: Status of the invoked Function. Functions that are invoked asynchronously can be in a queued InProgress state before they are invoked.
